values.description:
This PR adds support to the PR job to detect the Ubuntu image used in `bitbucket-pipelines.yml` and build the job in that DISTRO.

The implementation adds some logic in the DSL before calling the scripts to get the ubuntu release present in the yaml file. If the file is not present, the default is to use the CI reference platform.

Testing:

* default branch \(Xenial\)

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=14)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_math-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/14/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/14/console)


* gz11 branch \(Bionic\) fails because of lack of proper ign-cmake dependency

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=13)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_math-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/13/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/13)



Mental note: approve the scripts in [https://build.osrfoundation.org/scriptApproval/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/scriptApproval/) after merging.
values.title: Change ignition PR jobs to detect Ubuntu from bitbucket-pipelines.yml if present

summary.raw:
This PR adds support to the PR job to detect the Ubuntu image used in `bitbucket-pipelines.yml` and build the job in that DISTRO.

The implementation adds some logic in the DSL before calling the scripts to get the ubuntu release present in the yaml file. If the file is not present, the default is to use the CI reference platform.

summary.html:
This PR adds support to the PR job to detect the Ubuntu image used in bitbucket-pipelines.yml and build the job in that DISTRO.

The implementation adds some logic in the DSL before calling the scripts to get the ubuntu release present in the yaml file. If the file is not present, the default is to use the CI reference platform.

Testing:

  • default branch (Xenial)

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/14/console

  • gz11 branch (Bionic) fails because of lack of proper ign-cmake dependency

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/13/console

Mental note: approve the scripts in https://build.osrfoundation.org/scriptApproval/ after merging.

values.description:
subt repository is a bit special containing different stuff and a catkin package. To release it, we are going to follow the same way we did for alias and use nightly release \(from source, no tarball\) supported by a [-release repo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt-release/). The build job needs to be called manually through jenkins and will build the latest code in default branch.

I’ve generated a [prerelease](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-debbuilder/3/)  and testing the job [running the lava\_tube launch file](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install_pkg-bionic-amd64/2/console).
values.title: subt release support and testing job for installation

summary.raw:
subt repository is a bit special containing different stuff and a catkin package. To release it, we are going to follow the same way we did for alias and use nightly release \(from source, no tarball\) supported by a [-release repo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt-release/). The build job needs to be called manually through jenkins and will build the latest code in default branch.

I’ve generated a [prerelease](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-debbuilder/3/)  and testing the job [running the lava\_tube launch file](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install_pkg-bionic-amd64/2/console).

subt repository is a bit special containing different stuff and a catkin package. To release it, we are going to follow the same way we did for alias and use nightly release (from source, no tarball) supported by a -release repo. The build job needs to be called manually through jenkins and will build the latest code in default branch.

I’ve generated a prerelease and testing the job running the lava_tube launch file.

values.description: The goal is to detect from report to report if we miss any of the blue jobs. Sometimes is easy since the number of red/yellow just change but other times, when new projects appear in the list of the script is not trivial. I’m not sure if adding more information to every report with this PR worth covering this cases. @scpeters opinion?
values.title: Include blue jobs in buildcop script

summary.raw: The goal is to detect from report to report if we miss any of the blue jobs. Sometimes is easy since the number of red/yellow just change but other times, when new projects appear in the list of the script is not trivial. I’m not sure if adding more information to every report with this PR worth covering this cases. @scpeters opinion?

Sometimes is easy since the number of red/yellow just change but other times, when new projects appear in the list of the script is not trivial. values.description: `cat gz8.log` to make container logs visible on console output.
values.title: [gzdev] Display contents of gz8.log

summary.raw: `cat gz8.log` to make container logs visible on console output.
summary.html: cat gz8.log to make container logs visible on console output.

values.description:
After some digging around it seems like Gazebo does attempt to run in the container. But it's failing because there is no display output, and I guess no OpenGL context for Gazebo to launch in. The process terminates almost immediately so we can’t check that Gazebo is running.

> \[Err\] \[RenderEngine.cc:725\] Can't open display:
>
> \[Wrn\] \[RenderEngine.cc:93\] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
>
> \[Wrn\] \[RenderEngine.cc:293\] Cannot initialize render engine since render path type is NONE. Ignore this warning ifrendering has been turned off on purpose.
>
> \[Err\] \[GuiIface.cc:121\] QXcbConnection: Could not connect to display

This PR adds the following to the gzdev build script:

* ~~Display gz8.log file to make container logs visible.~~
* Install nvidia-docker

It won't fix the error shown above, but at least it will provide useful output and also allow us to test the call to `nvidia-docker` when the `--nivida` option is passed to gzdev.

‌

Perhaps installing and using Xvfb will do the trick with the rendering error shown above, but we can address this in a different PR.
values.title: Gzdev spawn CI debugging

summary.raw:
After some digging around it seems like Gazebo does attempt to run in the container. But it's failing because there is no display output, and I guess no OpenGL context for Gazebo to launch in. The process terminates almost immediately so we can’t check that Gazebo is running.

> \[Err\] \[RenderEngine.cc:725\] Can't open display:
>
> \[Wrn\] \[RenderEngine.cc:93\] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
>
> \[Wrn\] \[RenderEngine.cc:293\] Cannot initialize render engine since render path type is NONE. Ignore this warning ifrendering has been turned off on purpose.
>
> \[Err\] \[GuiIface.cc:121\] QXcbConnection: Could not connect to display

This PR adds the following to the gzdev build script:

* ~~Display gz8.log file to make container logs visible.~~
* Install nvidia-docker

It won't fix the error shown above, but at least it will provide useful output and also allow us to test the call to `nvidia-docker` when the `--nivida` option is passed to gzdev.

‌

Perhaps installing and using Xvfb will do the trick with the rendering error shown above, but we can address this in a different PR.
summary.html:
After some digging around it seems like Gazebo does attempt to run in the container. But it's failing because there is no display output, and I guess no OpenGL context for Gazebo to launch in. The process terminates almost immediately so we can’t check that Gazebo is running.

[Err] [RenderEngine.cc:725] Can't open display:

[Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:93] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled

[Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:293] Cannot initialize render engine since render path type is NONE. Ignore this warning ifrendering has been turned off on purpose.

[Err] [GuiIface.cc:121] QXcbConnection: Could not connect to display

This PR adds the following to the gzdev build script:

  • Display gz8.log file to make container logs visible.
  • Install nvidia-docker

It won't fix the error shown above, but at least it will provide useful output and also allow us to test the call to nvidia-docker when the --nivida option is passed to gzdev.

‌

Perhaps installing and using Xvfb will do the trick with the rendering error shown above, but we can address this in a different PR.

values.description: pgrep should look for a gzserver process instead of a gazebo process and gzdev spawn should run as a background process so that the build script can continue and detect whether gazebo is running, otherwise it will hang as spawn.py is logging the output of gazebo running in the docker container.
values.title: Fix bugs with gazebo_detection

summary.raw: pgrep should look for a gzserver process instead of a gazebo process and gzdev spawn should run as a background process so that the build script can continue and detect whether gazebo is running, otherwise it will hang as spawn.py is logging the output of gazebo running in the docker container.
summary.html: pgrep should look for a gzserver process instead of a gazebo process and gzdev spawn should run as a background process so that the build script can continue and detect whether gazebo is running, otherwise it will hang as spawn.py is logging the output of gazebo running in the docker container.

values.description:
Create a common support for gz11 branches \(\_gz1\_hook.bash\) that automatize different settings for getting the right Linux builds.

Converted the sdformat support to use this common base and ported ign-math and ign-transport:

* sdformat 

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/10/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/10/)


* ign-math

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=24)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_math-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/24/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/24/)


* ign-transport

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=17)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_transport-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/17/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/17/)
values.title: Common gz11 support for Linux, use it in: ign-math and ign-transport

values.description: The Brew bottle generation is archiving all the generated bottles from every build which increases the disk space needed by the Jenkins master. This PR limits then to the last 10 builds. //cc @scpeters
values.title: Limit Brew bottles artifact archive to the last 10 builds

summary.raw: The Brew bottle generation is archiving all the generated bottles from every build which increases the disk space needed by the Jenkins master. This PR limits then to the last 10 builds. //cc @scpeters

values.description:
The PR covers the intallation of the subt tarball to be able to run the smoke test. The changes are in the \`subt-compilation-base.bash\` file.

To support the tarball \(generated probably with catkin\_make\) I needed to implement the support for catkin\_make in our scripts \(previously only using catkin tools\).

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=30)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/30/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/30)

The build is failing because of the tests, probably related to the comms inside docker:

```shell
CommsClient::CommsClient() error: Local address shouldn't be empty
[addr] Bind() error: Address [other] is not your local address
[addr] Bind() error: Address [addr] already used
[addr] Bind() error: Address [multicast] already used
```

Other build using catkin tools and this branch:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_kinetic-xenial-amd64&build=89)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros\_gazebo\_pkgs-ci-default\_kinetic-xenial-amd64/89/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_kinetic-xenial-amd64/89/))
values.title: Fix the subt CI

The PR covers the intallation of the subt tarball to be able to run the smoke test. The changes are in the `subt-compilation-base.bash` file.

To support the tarball (generated probably with catkin_make) I needed to implement the support for catkin_make in our scripts (previously only using catkin tools).

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/30/

The build is failing because of the tests, probably related to the comms inside docker:

CommsClient::CommsClient() error: Local address shouldn't be empty
[addr] Bind() error: Address [other] is not your local address
[addr] Bind() error: Address [addr] already used
[addr] Bind() error: Address [multicast] already used

Other build using catkin tools and this branch:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_kinetic-xenial-amd64/89/)

values.description:
Implementation of ROS2 testing for gazebo\_ros2\_pkgs:

* Use DSL to generate the gazebo\_ros2\_pkgs
* ROS2 support in release-tools by setting the `USE_ROS2`variable to true \(default is false\).

Tested:

* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=_dsl_gazebo_ros_pkgs&build=364)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/\_dsl\_gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/364/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo_ros_pkgs/364)

values.description:
ign-plugin has had a 0.1.0~pre1 prerelease, so we can add it to ign-physics's list of dependencies

Are there any other packages that want to depend on ign-plugin?

Also, add eigen3 to `DEPEN_PKGS` for ign-physics so it will be installed by vcpkg.
values.title: add libignition-plugin-dev to dependency list for ign-physics

Are there any other packages that want to depend on ign-plugin?

Also, add eigen3 to `DEPEN_PKGS` for ign-physics so it will be installed by vcpkg.

values.description:
The ign-physics ABI build was failing to find the dart packages to install:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=18)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/18/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/18/

So this adds a `DART_FROM_PKGS_VAR_NAME` that gets `eval`d in generic-abi-base.bash, similar to the `ABI_JOB_PKG_DEPENDENCIES_VAR_NAME` variable.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=21)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/21/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/21/
values.title: Fix ign-physics ABI build

summary.raw:
The ign-physics ABI build was failing to find the dart packages to install:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=18)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/18/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/18/

So this adds a `DART_FROM_PKGS_VAR_NAME` that gets `eval`d in generic-abi-base.bash, similar to the `ABI_JOB_PKG_DEPENDENCIES_VAR_NAME` variable.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=21)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/21/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/21/
summary.html:
The ign-physics ABI build was failing to find the dart packages to install:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/18/

So this adds a DART_FROM_PKGS_VAR_NAME that gets evald in generic-abi-base.bash, similar to the ABI_JOB_PKG_DEPENDENCIES_VAR_NAME variable.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/21/

values.description:
I noticed a weird failure that I bisected to pull request #629

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_physics-pr-win&build=33)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/33/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/33/

~~~
The system cannot find the batch label specified - get_source_from_gazebodistro
~~~

It was perplexing because that PR didn't touch the label, but it seems to have triggered a bug that hits only sometimes when you have unix line endings in a batch

* https://web.archive.org/web/20160305063042/help.wugnet.com/windows/system-find-batch-label-ftopict615555.html

so to be safe I converted the line endings to dos for all our batch files
values.title: use unix2dos to give dos line endings to all bat files

summary.raw:
I noticed a weird failure that I bisected to pull request #629

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_physics-pr-win&build=33)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/33/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/33/

~~~
The system cannot find the batch label specified - get_source_from_gazebodistro
~~~

It was perplexing because that PR didn't touch the label, but it seems to have triggered a bug that hits only sometimes when you have unix line endings in a batch

* https://web.archive.org/web/20160305063042/help.wugnet.com/windows/system-find-batch-label-ftopict615555.html

so to be safe I converted the line endings to dos for all our batch files
summary.html:
I noticed a weird failure that I bisected to pull request #629

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/33/

The system cannot find the batch label specified - get_source_from_gazebodistro

It was perplexing because that PR didn't touch the label, but it seems to have triggered a bug that hits only sometimes when you have unix line endings in a batch

  • https://web.archive.org/web/20160305063042/help.wugnet.com/windows/system-find-batch-label-ftopict615555.html

so to be safe I converted the line endings to dos for all our batch files

values.description:
Some fixes to solve problems on subt CI:

* Report test results usind DSL
* Define GAZEBO\_PLUGIN\_PATH
* Use `subt_gazebo competition.launch` in smoke test 

I’ve tested this PR in 

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=12)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr\_any-bionic-amd64/12/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/12/))

There are a couple of issues:

1. The second test fails because gazebo was not finished properly after the first one. We can use the code in gazebo\_ros\_pkgs ros2 branch to achieve the correct tear down.
2. The first test complains about 

    [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib/librotors_gazebo_ros_interface_plugin.so: libmav_msgs.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Not sure why since the file seems to be in the right place and LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH and GAZEBO\_PLUGIN\_PATH seems fine to me:

    LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:/opt/ros/melodic/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64
    + echo 'GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:'
    GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:
    + find . -name libmav_msgs.so
    ./install/lib/libmav_msgs.so
values.title: Fix tests in subt CI

summary.raw:
Some fixes to solve problems on subt CI:

* Report test results usind DSL
* Define GAZEBO\_PLUGIN\_PATH
* Use `subt_gazebo competition.launch` in smoke test 

I’ve tested this PR in 

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=12)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr\_any-bionic-amd64/12/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/12/))

There are a couple of issues:

1. The second test fails because gazebo was not finished properly after the first one. We can use the code in gazebo\_ros\_pkgs ros2 branch to achieve the correct tear down.
2. The first test complains about 

    [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib/librotors_gazebo_ros_interface_plugin.so: libmav_msgs.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Not sure why since the file seems to be in the right place and LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH and GAZEBO\_PLUGIN\_PATH seems fine to me:

    LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:/opt/ros/melodic/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64
    + echo 'GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:'
    GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:
    + find . -name libmav_msgs.so
    ./install/lib/libmav_msgs.so
summary.html:
Some fixes to solve problems on subt CI:

  • Report test results usind DSL
  • Define GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH
  • Use subt_gazebo competition.launch in smoke test

I’ve tested this PR in

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/12/)

There are a couple of issues:

  1. The second test fails because gazebo was not finished properly after the first one. We can use the code in gazebo_ros_pkgs ros2 branch to achieve the correct tear down.

  2. The first test complains about

    [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib/librotors_gazebo_ros_interface_plugin.so: libmav_msgs.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Not sure why since the file seems to be in the right place and LD_LIBRARY_PATH and GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH seems fine to me:

LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:/opt/ros/melodic/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64
+ echo 'GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:'
GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/ws/install/lib:
+ find . -name libmav_msgs.so
./install/lib/libmav_msgs.so

values.description:
Whipped this up after locally testing the Dockerfile and build.sh from this failed job [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/6/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/6/console)

‌

I’m not sure if it’s the right fix-- Perhaps the mk-build-deps script should update the apt repos internally for example-- but it will at least allow packages to build.
values.title: Ensure local apt database is up-to-date before installing build deps.

summary.raw:
Whipped this up after locally testing the Dockerfile and build.sh from this failed job [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/6/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ign-math6-debbuilder/6/console)

‌

I’m not sure if it’s the right fix-- Perhaps the mk-build-deps script should update the apt repos internally for example-- but it will at least allow packages to build.

values.description:
The `ign-physics` and `ign-sensors` now have gz11 features in their default branches, which is causing their default branch builds to fail in jenkins:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/

This branch will hopefully fix that by changing the logic in `_gz11_hook.bash` a bit and declaring `NEEDS_GZ11_SUPPORT=true` in the physics and sensors build scripts.

Testing:

* ~~[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=13)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/13/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/13/~~
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=14)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=14)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/

I have some additional ideas for follow-up PR's to improve gz11 detection for the `-any-` builds and to regularly test the gz11 branches like release branches; but I'll save that for later.
values.title: support gz11 on default branches for ign-physics/sensors

summary.raw:
The `ign-physics` and `ign-sensors` now have gz11 features in their default branches, which is causing their default branch builds to fail in jenkins:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/

This branch will hopefully fix that by changing the logic in `_gz11_hook.bash` a bit and declaring `NEEDS_GZ11_SUPPORT=true` in the physics and sensors build scripts.

Testing:

* ~~[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=13)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/13/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/13/~~
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=14)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=14)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/

I have some additional ideas for follow-up PR's to improve gz11 detection for the `-any-` builds and to regularly test the gz11 branches like release branches; but I'll save that for later.
summary.html:
The ign-physics and ign-sensors now have gz11 features in their default branches, which is causing their default branch builds to fail in jenkins:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/11/

This branch will hopefully fix that by changing the logic in _gz11_hook.bash a bit and declaring NEEDS_GZ11_SUPPORT=true in the physics and sensors build scripts.

Testing:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/13/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-bionic-amd64/14/

I have some additional ideas for follow-up PR's to improve gz11 detection for the -any- builds and to regularly test the gz11 branches like release branches; but I'll save that for later.
